metadata.title: CVE-2019-18790 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in channels/chan_sip.c in Sangoma Asterisk 13.xbefore 13.29.2, 16.x before 16.6.2, and 17.x before 17.0.1, and CertifiedAsterisk 13.21 before cert5. A SIP request can be sent to Asterisk that canchange a SIP peer's IP address. A REGISTER does not need to occur, andcalls can be hijacked as a result. The only thing that needs to be known isthe peer's name; authentication details such as passwords do not need to beknown. This vulnerability is only exploitable when the nat option is set tothe default, or auto_force_rport.

criterions.comment: asterisk package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
